doc.after: The population of Egypt grew from 30,083,419 in 1966[86] to roughly 79,000,000 by 2008.[87] The vast majority of Egyptians live near the banks of the Nile, in an area of about 40,000 square kilometers (15,000Â sqÂ mi) where the only arable land is found. In late 2010, about 40 percent of Egypt's population lived on the equivalent of roughly USD$2 per day, with a large portion relying on subsidized goods.[1]
